results.title: Biko: Breaking the silence
results.brief_description: A political documentary shot in Zimbabwe and South Africa, this commemorates the 10th anniversary of Steve Biko’s death. It provides an insight into the complexities of the politics of the last decade, pivoting on the powerfully influential character of Biko. The film defines the aims of the Black Consciousness Movement of which Biko was an active and important leader, and explores its relevance from inception in the late 60s to the present day. It includes interviews with friends and medical and professional colleagues.

results.title: Learn to Ski
results.brief_description: Aimed at the beginner skier and provides comprehensive information on ski equipment and technique. It shows how easy skiing can be, once you know what gear is required, how to select it in the proper size, how to put it on and how to control speed and direction when skiing. It takes you step by step through the equipment and techniques used in both cross country and downhill skiing at resorts.

results.title: Cane toads: an unnatural history
results.creator_credit: Mark Lewis, Tristram Miall and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Bufo Marinus, the cane toad, was introduced into Queensland in 1935 for a specific reason - to combat the grey-back beetle that was destroying the sugar cane crop. The mission failed : the beetle could fly and the cane toad couldn’t. Oblivious of its failure, the cane toad settled extremely well into its new surroundings and proceeded to breed so rapidly that it has now become a pest of plague proportions. This amusing documentary blends biological fact with human comment to show how the cane toads have become an accepted part of local culture and popular mythology.

results.title: Mr Squiggle and Friends
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Julia Kalytis and Pam Verrall
results.brief_description: Mr. Squiggle and his friends have been entertaining Australian children for almost 30 years on ABC television. Now he lives in Bandywallop and is just as much fun as ever. This first video of Mr. Squiggle has all his favourite friends including Roxanne, sharing adventures with Bill and Gus, Merv Wallop and his nephew Wayne. Episodes include : “Squiggle”, “Settlers’ Week”, “The Knapsack”. Rated: G

results.title: Play School. the All Together Show; at the Zoo
results.brief_description: The “All together show” is a delightful compilation of well known Play school songs and stories produced by seven well loved Play school presenters - Benita Collings, John Hambelin, Noni Hazelhurst, Jan Kinsbury, Alistair Smart, Don Spencer and John Waters. In “At the zoo” Play school visits Sydney’s Taronga Zoo. Jan Kinsbury, Elaine Hudson and Don Spencer look at the monkeys, chimpanzees, giraffes, lions and seals, as well as a rabbit, a turtle, a baby kangaroo and the animals at the Zoo’s Friendship farm.

results.title: Romper Room
results.brief_description: At last, the longest running and most loved television pre-school program is on video for you to enjoy with your children. Join Miss Susan, Miss Patricia, Miss Helena and Miss Megan, and of course Mr. Do Bee, for all the favourite songs and games from Romper Room.

results.title: Feathers, fur or fins
results.brief_description: This delightful children’s program is a compilation of different episodes from the popular “Playmates” television series screened on the ABC, and it explores a wide range of Australian animals through songs and looking at animals. Contains some animated sequences.

results.title: Dinosaurs: fun, facts and fantasy
results.creator_credit: Clive Doig, Malcolm Craddock and Picture Palace Productions
results.brief_description: This informative and entertaining program is a mixture of puppets, songs, animated models, drawings, old film footage and dramatised sequences, and it will answer everything you ever wanted to know about dinosaurs.

results.title: Cockleshell Bay
results.brief_description: A series of short animated stories about Robin and Rosie Cockle who move to Cockleshell Bay with their parents to set up a guest house. Whilst there they befriend old Mr Ship and Gran Routie who help them in their play. Rated: G

results.title: Button Moon
results.brief_description: Mr and Mrs Spoon and Tina T Spoon live on Junk Planet where everything is created from household items. In each adventure they visit Button Moon in their space ship. Through their telescope they see lots of interesting stories. Rated: G
